cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then slowing and turning north toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana–Mississippi–Alabama area) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the LA/MS/AL coastline

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Grand Isle LA to AL/FL border; Tropical Storm Watch: AL/FL border to Ochlockonee River FL; Storm-Surge Watch: mouth of the Mississippi River to AL/FL border and adjacent bays
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southern & eastern Gulf of Mexico tonight–Sunday, then north-central Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL-western FL Panhandle) Monday–Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) possible this evening, but sustained gale-force winds unlikely at PortMiami
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side of south Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 2–4 inches tonight with isolated higher totals; potential for urban/flash flooding in the Miami metro area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low tornado risk through tonight and dangerous surf/rip currents along south-east Florida beaches
